intro: Litobrochia angustata, commonly known as the narrowleaf litobrochia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
